SEG.ORIGINAL_TEXT: Court records: Accused killer came from broken but financially stable Columbia
Accused Charleston church shooter Dylann Roof came from a Columbia family that
was well off financially but rocked by divorce, an unsettling move to Florida
in Roof’s early teen years and alleged physical abuse, Richland County family
There is nothing in the records indicating how or why Roof began to steep
himself in extremist white-supremacy doctrines that law enforcement authorities
say led to Wednesday’s killings of nine African-Americans at Charleston’s
Court records say that Franklin B. Roof, familiarly called “Benn,” and Paige
Roof, Dylann Roof’s stepmother, were married Nov. 27, 1998, in Monroe City, Fla.
Benn Roof had two children from a previous marriage – Dylann, born in 1994, and
Amber, born in 1988, according to an affidavit by Paige Roof, Benn’s second
wife, now divorced from him. In 2000, Paige and Benn Roof had a daughter, who
Paige Roof wrote she was the primary caregiver for all three children in a
February 2009 affidavit that is part of the couple’s divorce record in family
“I raised his kids from a very young age, took them to all of their activities
and Benn’s kids have spent almost every weekend with me,” she wrote in the
affidavit. “Benn travels a great deal, usually four days a week, so I would
always care for and raise his kids.”
Dylann Roof’s relationship with his biological mother at the time is unclear.
A friend of Paige’s wrote in a letter to the court that she was supportive of
Dylann Roof after the couple’s 2009 separation. “She always made sure Dylann
was able to visit his father, even taking him to and from his house almost
every weekend. She has been very active in all of the children’s lives for the
past 10 years caring for them as her own,” the friend wrote.
About the same time Dylann’s father and stepmother began the fights that
eventually led to their 2011 divorce, Dylann dropped out of school, in the
ninth grade. He briefly had attended Dreher High School in Columbia and White
Knoll High School in Lexington County.
From 2000-05, the family lived in Columbia. Paige was a “stay-at-home mom,”
cooking and cleaning and taking care of the three children, according to the
“Benn’s business escalated so well financially, that we finally moved into our
dream home on Park Street in Columbia,” the affidavit said.
Around 2005, Benn Roof moved the family to the Florida Keys, according to Paige
Roof’s affidavit. “I absolutely did not want to go because (their
then-5-year-old daughter) had made friends here and my family and friends were
After the family moved to Florida, the “marriage really began to deteriorate,”
the affidavit said. In 2008, Paige Roof alleged physical abuse at the hands of
Benn, and photos are part of the court record.
In the preceding years, Benn Roof had done well in his business, making
$168,066 in 2008, the affidavit said. Benn and Paige Roof also owned two houses
in Columbia worth approximately $179,000, as well as two houses in the Florida
Keys worth approximately $1.1 million, according to the affidavit.
In 2008, the couple moved back to Columbia. In December of that year, after
Paige and their now 8-year-old daughter moved out of the Columbia house they
shared with Benn Roof, she asked for custody, child support and to be allowed
possession of one of the houses.
Little is known about Dylann Roof’s biological mother. A 2005 obituary for
Amber and Dylann Roof’s grandmother shows that the siblings are the children of
Amelia “Amy” Roof. A friend of Amelia Roof’s also confirmed that she is his
